name: Mohammad Nadeem
label: Software Engineer
summary: Currently working as a Software Engineer (i.e. moving protos) @ Google NYC

work.summary: Currently working at Google as part of the Engineering Residency program, where residents do two months of trainings, followed by two 4.5 month rotations on different teams.
highlights: Completed the Engineering Residency curriculum by making two projects to get acquainted with Google's tooling and technologies

work.summary: Worked as an intern on the internal automation team
highlights: Migrated an old Github notification service used by developer teams to use AWS CloudFormation.
Created a service to automate JIRA ticket creation using AWS Lambda, Github API and JIRA API.
Contributed to an inner source project to validate AWS CloudFormation templates used by all developers within the company.
Worked with a group on interns on a capstone project to propose solutions for hiring and retaining nurses and presented the idea to executives.

work.company: Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey
work.summary: Worked as a research assistant on an adaptive underwater sampling project at Rutgers University where I got experience with a lot of different technology, managed a group of students and worked with REU funding
highlights: Researched how to use iterative feedback control systems to enable an underwater rover to be autonomous and implementing a control system for the robot using Python.
Researched in creating a communications protocol and algorithm to be used for distributed sampling, task allocation, and coordination.
Researching using multi agent reinforcement learning for underwater sampling methods.
Submitted a paper titled “Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning for Underwater Adaptive Sampling Using Autonomous Vehicles” to the ACM WUWNet conference
Creating a IoT architecture for underwater pollution monitoring systems

work.summary: Worked as an instructor at a tech summer camp teaching and inspiring kids about technology and computer science
highlights: Taught over 40 students four different courses in order to cultivate student interest in computer science.
Taught Python, C++, Java, PyGame, Processing, Raspberry Pi and Scratch.
Created daily lesson plans for each course using blended learning techniques.

work.company: Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey
work.summary: Worked as a help desk consultant in the ECS department, which was responsible for the School of Engineering's IT infrastructure.
highlights: Ensure proper care and security of computer labs.
Identify, analyze and troubleshoot students’ and faculty’s technical problems.
Run scripts to add and update user accounts.

education.institution: Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey
education.area: Double Major in Electrical and Computer Engineering and Computer Science, Minor in Mathematics

awards.title: First Prize Winner (ex aequo) for the 2019 IEEE Communications Society (ComSoc) Student Competition "Communications Technology Changing the World"
awards.summary: For designing LICOT: Litter-Information-Centric Ocean of Things, a dynamic IoT network that changed based on the kind of pollution detected.

publications.name: "UW-MARL: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning for Underwater Adaptive Sampling Using Autonomous Vehicles"
publications.authors: M. Rahmati, M. Nadeem, V. Sadhu, and D. Pompili
publications.publisher: Proc. of the ACM International Conference on Underwater Networks and Systems (WUWNet)

projects.name: Object Classification with Wi-Fi (Capstone Design Project)
description: Leveraged the Atheros CSI tool for Ubuntu Linux to extract Channel State Information (CSI) from wifi packets to classify objects
Designed and conducted experiments to collect data to use in object classification
Created a networking application to allow synchronization between transmitter and receiver
Created a GUI application using PyQt to allow ease of classification
Created a server to enable live classification of the object based on the CSI information recieved

projects.name: AUVKit
description: Designed AUVKit, a Python library for communicating, controlling and writing apps for AUVs
Goals were to reduce development time for autonomous missions and fix system issues regarding data fetching, while improving performance

projects.name: Distributed File System
description: Created a distributed, replicated file system similar to the Google File System for CS 417 (Disributed Systems)
Used Java RPC libraries to implement the distributed nodes
Created a user facing command line interface to put, get and delete files

projects.name: Neural Network Hardware Accelerator
description: Designed a neural network layer in Verilog to accelerate computational tasks for neural network

projects.name: Distributed Adaptive Sampling
description: Designed and implemented a distributed adaptive sampling algorithm for networked autonomous underwater vehicles to reduce energy and time consumption.

projects.name: Smart Lock
description: Designed an entire smart lock platform and architecture with a team of 10 people
Worked with a team member to create a web client and server for streaming video from a Raspberry Pi using Websockets
Used Google Maps API to visualize reported data about suspicious activity
Worked with a team member to create a REST API server using Django

projects.name: RU BUSEE (in progress)
description: Design and develop an API to predict Rutgers bus timings using TransLoc API
Use a custom algorithm that allowed for more advanced features such as detecting bus delays using previous data
Create a Flutter mobile application for users to access data

projects.name: Photos
description: Created an Android app in which the user can create albums, add photos to albums, view photos, and add and search tags for Software Methodology.
Also implemented in JavaFX as well. Used an extensive amount of data structures and algorithms knowledge to create the database feature.

projects.name: RU BUS
description: Created a Pebble Watch app to show Rutgers bus timings using Nextbus API and Pebble.js
